paper_metadata.title: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis in mainland China: a unicentric retrospective study
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.demographics: 42 male, 12 female; average age at onset 47.8 ± 13.0 years
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTR) with symptoms including sensory-motor neuropathy, autonomic dysfunction, and cardiomyopathy.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The average age of patients at the onset of the disease was 47.8 ± 13.0 years.

functional_data.summary: The study identified 22 different mutations in the TTR gene.

variants.segregation_data: The Val30Met mutation was found in 10 families, with 90% of probands being late-onset.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the heterogeneity of TTR mutations in the Chinese population.
key_quotes: A total of 22 different TTR mutations were identified.
Val30Met remains the most common mutation type in mainland China.

tables_processed.table_caption: Demographic and clinical characteristics of ATTR cases with Val30Met and Ala97Ser mutations.
Demographic and clinical characteristics of ATTR cases with other mutations of study cohort.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for TTR variants were extracted from the main text and tables.
